name: Zucchini Muffins
ingredients: 1 and 3/4 cup all-purpose flour or whole wheat flour or mix
2 large eggs at room temperature (get chickens so these are always handy!)
optional: 1 cup dark chocolate chips, 1/2 cup walnuts (can add to half the batch if some don't like the nuts)
steps: Preheat oven to 425, use 12 count muffin pan

whisk flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg together. set aside. in medium bowl, whisk oil, sugar, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla, and milk together. whisk in shredded zucchini. Pour wet ingredients into the dry and combine. Fold in any add-ins and avoid over-mixing
spoon batter in, fill to the top
bake for 5 min at 425, then keeping muffins in oven, reduce heat to 350 and continue baking for 15 min (for mini muffins, make 11-13 min at 350 for the whole time)
allow muffins to cool for 5 min in muffin pan, then transfer to a wire rack to continue cooling or enjoy warm
Can store in fridge for a week. I also love putting them in the freezing and defrosting in the microwave on low when I get a craving!
story: My friend Debbie had these at her house when I went to visit and she warmed it up and we had a cup of tea. She has a really cozy Airbnb on Claytor Lake where we met when I stayed with her to look for our house in Max Meadows, VA. She always had a muffin and a boiled farm-fresh egg (she is obsessed with farmers markets in the area). Her tip is to always use less sugar than the recipe calls for, so it's up to you with this one whether it is breakfast or dessert -Sierra
